Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good low-light performance, full 1080p high-definition video, sharp LCD resolution, can zoom while shooting video
Cons: Soft images, lacks shutter and aperture priority modes, noisy zoom motor in video mode, poorly placed pop-up flash
The Nikon Coolpix S8100 is a speedy ultra-zoom that performs well even in dim settings, reviews say. Packed with a 12-megapixel CMOS sensor for less image noise, the S8100 displays better low-light versatility than most shooters, but "textures and edges lose sharpness" at low ISO levels, says Liam McCabe at DigitalCamera-HQ.com. ...

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Solid Shooter with some fun options
Item.Review: I wanted this camera to be our all-purpose go-to camera, easy for travel. I also wanted it to take photos of products I make and sell on etsy. It's working out great for both uses. I had to learn a bit how to adjust and get my lighting right for the product photos- but they're turning out great. The detail is amazing. The clarity is great. Now that I've figured out how to adjust white balance (called hue on this camera) It's really going well. Oh- and it's so fast! I compared and researched until my head was spinning- and my general love of Nikons plus the fast speed of this camera (I checked it out in a local store) won me over. It doesn't feel flimsy either. I love the night portrait feature. I've taken pics at night on a camping trip (the day after we got the camera!) and they turned ... out great. Compared the night portrait with just regular flash- no contest. The night features flash but don't wash out the subject. And, you can tell it's night still. Used the macro function on the trip as well to snap pics of some flora- got great results. Was easily able to focus in on a flower and blur the background- with the camera just an inch in front of the flower- it's clear and crisp and the color is outstanding. The screen on the camera is so clear- it's easy to see what you're getting and to view/review shots. I love the smile feature as well- that's a lot of fun. I thought the pop up flash would be hard to get used to, but so far it's not. Although I haven't had need of the flash too much. Once the flash is up it's not a big deal. It's just remembering on that first flash pic that it will pop up. There is a tiny bit of space to the left of it so that I can have my finger on the corner (I notice in the newer model that the flash is almost flush with the outside edge- I like this design better) It's small but feels sturdy in your hands. Great big lens- all in all I love it. negatives- I knew this purchasing, but no there aren't that many manual controls here. But the ones I really need to have are there (exposure, white balance, etc) I wouldn't say that's a negative, just wouldnt be for everyone. I wanted a point and shoot- this is a great one. pop up flash- I worried about it and still hope that I don't do something to break it (forget it's up and put it in the case, for example) but I don't foresee this to really be an issue. I think that I've gotten used to it enough to be mindful. Last potential negative: I went ahead and purchased an external battery charger- I just don't want to have to have the camera plugged in. I think an external battery charger is pretty essential- especially as I purchased an extra battery and plan to always have a charged one ready to go. I haven't noticed extremely short battery life- I suppose it depends on shooting conditions, flash, video usage, etc. But I played around with the camera for a full day, then used it a lot on a camping trip, and when I got back just a bit. Only then did battery say low. I wasn't using video much/at all during this time. I was pleased. I took around 200+ pics (minimum) during this time playing around with all the settings and such, reviewing lots as well. I'm happy. I love it. I'd recommend it. I think it's a solid little camera with just enough bells and whistles. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Camera is everything I hoped for!
Item.Review:
Pros: Features and color quality are superb!
Cons: The pop up flash sometimes is held down by accident because of where it is located. Just have to get used to it!
I did some major research before buying this camera. It is top of the line regarding specs on a point and shoot, including the HD 1080 video capability. The camera is easy to use, despite the 200 page manual that can be downloaded online! The camera has a sensor equivalent to SLR cameras so the colors are very true to life. It does an exceptional job taking pictures with no flash even in low light conditions. There is no lag time after taking photos or when spooling through photos in the view finder. I needed a high quality camera small enough to keep in my purse at all times--the next models up--Nikon 100 and 110 ... were too large to consider for my needs. A great camera that will do high end work in a small package deal! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Full HD in small size and low price
Item.Review: This is a well designed point and shoot camera with full HD (1080p)video mode. The are not many cameras in the market that gives full HD mode video capability in handy size. A perfect camera for traveling. Excellent battery life, large viewing screen and excellent picture quality. It is extremely easy to use. The price is just about right. However, I am little disappointed that the camera does not have RAW shooting mode.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: features
Cons: pop-up flash placement
Just getting started with this Nikon and so far I'm impressed with the speed and features of the 8100. Startup time and shot to shot times are reletively low (good) for this price range. View screen is super-sharp, 10x zoom and HD video, build quality and image stab. hard to beat at $149.
Also, on my first battery charge I'm at 350+ shots and it's still going strong!
Only negative is the pop-up flash placement. I'll need to retrain my grip placement. Not a deal breaker though.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: For a point and shoot, this is an excellent camera. I like the layout, it's easy to navigate. The 10x zoom was another great selling point. I've used the camera a fair portion, but today I drained the battery. I was a little surprised, but I did use the flash more than usual. I bought this camera, for it's low light capabilities. I prefer using existing lighting, and for that it does well. I will be ordering at least one backup battery, possibly two. I read other reviews that said the battery didn't last long. Given the size, this is understandable. Some have said there is a lag in the shutter speed, I haven't noticed. What I have noticed, is the camera takes a while to process an image when using the backlit setting. Not a big deal for me. I'm presently on a road trip, and too ... k this camera rather then my D50. I prefer my DSLR, but the ease of carrying this on the plane, and the quick availability for use under the conditions I'm in, make it the best. I believe this is the best camera for a point & shoot in any given situation. I would recommend adding a spare battery to your purchase. There are camera cases, that allow you to carry accessories, such as a battery, and SD cards. Though I use an 8gb card, and seriously doubt I'll need any more. This is a great camera and loaded with a lot of features. You just need to take the time to learn how to operate it in the various conditions. I own several Nikon's, and I believe they have the best camera's and lens for the money. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 3 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast/accurate auto-focus; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Nice Body Color; Small / Compact
Bought this camera specifically for a trip to Disney World with our grandchildren. I can't say enough about how impressed I am with this camera's "Night Landscape" setting. I got beautiful shots of the electrical parade, fireworks at the castle, illuminated buildings and reflections in the water. Also being able to record movies with the press of a single button and that 10x zoom just made this the perfect camera to take on a trip. I carried it in a pocket of my very small purse. I also own a Nikon D300s which is spectacular but I didn't want to bring a DSLR on this trip. I also purchased an extra battery which I never had to use. You will not be disappointed by the S8100 in any way.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Wonderful camera, easy to use with lots of extras
Item.Review:
Pros: Rich colors, quality prints
Cons: Software is nothing extraordinary
I really love this camera. I am a first time Nikon user. I love the rich colors and great quality of the pictures. It is flexible, can be a point and shoot, or I can fiddle with the settings for those special effects. It's small and travels well. The software that comes with the camera is basic, nothing extraordinary, but it gets the organizing job done. Overall, I am very excited about my purchase and look forward to years of memories in pictures.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Quality Camera and built well, perfect photo
Item.Review:
Pros: Nikon 8100 has great battery life, ease in menu use and shoots great photos
Cons: flash pop up can be annoying until you get use to its location
This is a great camera. I wanted a Canon, but too many negatives with the new models. Nikon 8100 has great battery life, ease in menu use and shoots great photos without making any adjustments. I do like the speed for competitive sports, kids in swim team competition to my son playing football. I did invest in a 8Gbyte Class10 SDHC card from Sandisk Class6 minimum for shooting HD video. The zoom lens is perfect for the outdoor shots, and still has wide angle for indoor. Closest competitor is Canon S95 but is priced too high and lacks some of the 8100 features. Great Buy, no Best Buy for the money hands down!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: good price for all the features
Cons: trouble focusing
This is my first Nikon camera and it may be my last. I wanted a P+S with high zoom, cant always carry the DSLR everywhere. Was originally going to buy the Panasonic zs7 but came across the s8100 in store. Unfortunately the floor model wasn't working but it was the right price at $219. On paper the s8100 looks like a champ but is frustrating at times during usage. The main problem is the slow and inaccurate focusing, especially in low light. The HD video quality is quite good, if you don't use the zoom. Once you zoom the camera loses focus not to mention you can hear the motor during video playback. Another thing is the long time between shots when using the flash. After each shot the screen goes blank and a red ligh ... t starts blinking, I'm guessing it means the flash is "recharging" ,I may be wrong, but i know that it takes about 3 sec. before its ready for another shot. I needed a fast and accurate camera...this was not it. it also lacks manual controls. I knew from the beginning that it didn't have such features, but with all the talk about night shooting performance and its CMOS sensor, i was willing to give it a shot. I really like the look the of the camera and the weight, it doesn't feel cheap. I really wanted to like this camera but i just found myself frustrated. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought the S8100 cause i wanted a lightweight travel zoom camera for all my holiday snapshots - a don't think just shoot camera who fits in my pocket, and cause i do not want to carry my canon SLRs around in my vacation time. So I use the S8100 side by side with my Olympus E-p2. The Nikon is for tourist stuff and the Olympus i use if i find something more interesting when Im traveling which could be worth a reportage or other i can sell. Nikon S8100 - The good things. First of all the camera performs well in low light situations (night scene mode). The camera handles noise in high ISO areas impressive for a small sensor, and the stabilizer works great in low light to - even handheld. overall the camera is fun to shoot with (specially if you are used to a heavy SLR where you have tota ... l control). There are no geo tagging which I think is a big plus that Nikon do not follow all the other companies (panasonic, Leica, Sony and so on...) who seem more interested in stupid features as the geo tagging than the actual picture and video quality (Well done Nikon!) The Camera is well build (besides a couple of flip floppy plastic covers). And the ergonomics is great, so the camera is easy to hold and you do not accidently hit buttons while you are shooting. Nikon S8100 - The bad things. No RAW shooting. The camera has very limited user control and it is a bit frustrating that you do not have the shutter priority or the aperture priority. The flash - can not be controlled, it is not possible to turn it down or up and that is not good when the flash automatics often is to strong. The automatic scene mode (who decides what kind of scene you are shooting) is not very intelligent and 8 out of 10 times it doesn't get the scene right. in low light with or without flash, the camera has a very hard time photographing moving objects - even if they are moving slow. Overall the camera is a fine point and shoot camera it does the job snapshooting family, parties, vacations. The 10X zoom is a bit slow compared to sony or canon point and shoot cams and that can be a bit irritating. I have not noticed any distortion when zooming or shooting at the widest (30 mm). I probably wont look for nikons small cameras next time Im buying a point and shoot, because it is offering that much value for money. It seems that Sony or Canon cameras is slightly better in build quality has a faster zoom, offers more manual like controls, shoots and focuses faster (specially the Sony hx5v which is a lot faster). The Nikon S8100 photo quality looks fine but its not a revolution, and I really miss the RAW files when i edit. My girlfriend now use the camera, she is new to photography so i thought the camera would be perfect for her, but it seems that it is not, because of the cameras complete auto modes which often makes the wrong decisions. In short terms - you have to know to much about what the different auto modes does to avoid getting to many ruined photos. So if the camera (as i think it is) is made for people who just wanna shoot and not think then it is in my opinion a failure. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera because I realized that I truly needed a travel camera...something that was not as bulky as my D300 but still took great photos..A camera that I could pocket and take on a moments notice. This camera fits the bill fantastically. The display is big and brite...the menus that alittle getting used to but then again what menus system is'nt? The camera has almost no shutter lag...photos are as good as the ones from the D300. Great in low light. Video quality is good but dont pan too quickly and the mic picks up every sound. Things I did not like: The camera is not great for taking photos of moving objects or people in motion. The flash is poorly positioned and the battery life is relatively short.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, HD, Zoom feature, panorama software
Cons: flash placement, focus speed, battery life.
I bought this camera about a month ago. I have used it pretty regularly, I like to take shots and videos of sunrises and sunsets. I must admit I am still getting used to all the settings one can change. I also admit I am having a great deal of fun with it. I have found that using a tripod is a good idea if taking a lot of pictures. I love the HD video although I would like it to take longer ones, but of course I have a camcorder for that. Quality of video is quite nice. Have had a bit of annoyance with the flash but since I do not use it I turned off auto flash. Its there if i need it. Plenty of space for videos or pictures. The first time I used it I took over 900 pho ... tos most of which turned out quite nicely. Video of course drains the battery faster as is to be expected. Overall a good quality camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought the S8100 as an easily pocket-able alternative to my DSLR, and it serves this function quite well. The camera is better looking in person than the photos imply; other particularly good features include: The LCD panel, which is the same sort as you get on a modern high-end Nikon DSLR, the range of the lens and the VR system. Issues with the camera, although few, include lack of manual controls (ISO and white balance only) and a hard shutter push. This makes it more difficult to take sharp pictures at longer exposures. The lens is also not the fastest, being f/4.0 or above for most of its working range. The camera is reasonably good at low light, but only meters down to a 1-second exposure, despite having a tripod mount. It also does not accept the cable release used with Nikon ... DSLRs. Although the camera has no optical viewfinder, I'm not rating that as a con; optical viewfinders on compact cameras are almost universally useless. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A good camera, with a few 'buts'
Item.Review: Seems well made except the battery door which is flimsy. (same thing on my daughters Nikon, a different model). No 'manual' setting to speak of, but auto mode is ok for most situations. Other people have commented about how the Flash pops up under your finger, but can be gotten used to. Picture quality seems quite good, but video has that herky-jerky look, like all AVCHD compression cameras have (not a Nikon issue). I like the 'super slo mo' video. It only records like that for 10 seconds-it's not Hi-Def and no audio, but still a fun extra to have. When recording video, I recommend using the menu to turn ON the wind screen, which is basically a low cut filter, to cut out some of the zoom motor noise. I like the dedicated, separate button to record video, and knob selection of 5 shot sequen ... ce mode. My s8100 had a dead pixel or two, which was noticable in dark video, [...] expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I did a lot of research in choosing this camera. I use it while upland game hunting with my Brittany.It fits nicely in a shirt pocket for easy access. The screen is very clear even in bright sunlight. Photos are excellent and video is crazy good. I like the dedicated easy to find video button. Take the time to read the manual , very smart camera. Also B&H blew away everyone on the price.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I believe this is my 4th Nikon digital camera and I continue to be happy with their products. I love the size and the rubberized feel of this unit and the picture quality is what I expected from Nikon. Still playing with all the different features including the video capabilities. So far so good. The low light pictures are some of the best I've seen and daylight photos are very good. You can't go wrong with this unit and the price at Dell.com was very competetive. Thanks.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: So far, so good ... with a few snags
Item.Review: The main purpose for getting this camera is to shoot pix of my nephew and take hd-quality video. The video aspect is great. You're allowed to zoom in/out while in video mode, but it will produce a zooming sound that is recorded on said videos. You just have to decide whether the option for the zoom overrides the noise it creates. The focus is hit or miss. When it DOES focus correctly, the image quality is superb. When trying different settings, it focuses better on some than on others. And the focus isn't quick -- so if you're wanting to capture those quick moments and not have it turn out as a blur, this isn't all that great. The continuous shooting mode I thought would be better than it is - it will take 5 shots all at once, but you hear no shutter sound to know that it's still taking ... the picture - just a black screen. This is a bit frustrating for me - I like to know what's happening!Overall, I think the image quality is great WHEN it actually focuses. One annoying factor is that the battery needs to be in the camera, then plugged in to a USB port to charge. You can buy an external charger for an extra [$] but if you bought every accessory you needed to make your life convenient on this, you'd be spending upwards of [$] on this camera! I bought an additional 3rd party battery to go with it, a 3rd party battery charger, and a 3 LCD screen protector for mine & I think my total was around [$]. Fortunately I didn't need to buy another camera case since my old one is still holding up just fine. If you're using the video portion for extended periods of time, you're going to want that extra battery, as the battery life will drain fairly quickly if you're constantly in video mode. The 10x zoom is AMAZING! Now I don't need to be right up in people's faces when trying to get some great candid shots. Definitely a great feature on this camera.I also have a Nikon D5000, and although the picture quality is better, that camera is too large and heavy to carry around for quick trips to the park. It's also an [$] camera, so it should take better pictures & focus quicker, etc. Bottom line: I like the camera & am still learning how to use all of its features. I would like to try out the Panasonic Lumix, though, and see if it was better at focusing. If it is, I might just switch. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The pictures and the movies.
Cons: The access door and the flash location.
I like everything about this camera except for two things:
1) The door that goes to the compartment for the battery and memory stick is impossible to open and even harded to close. I had another Coolpix prior to this, and it did not have this pain-in-the-neck problem.
2) The location for the flash is a problem due to the fact that I usually have my hand/finger right there, preventing the flash from popping up. This is also a serious flaw.
Otherwise, this is the finest camera I have ever owned, and when I take these beautiful pictures, I can't wait to see them on a large screen or on a print. The wheel to select the mode makes life much easier over the old Coolpix I had, makin ... g this a definite upgrade for me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I wanted to like this camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Easy To Use; Great Zoom; Small / Compact; Large Clear LCD
Cons: Poor Flash; Poor Image Quality
I really wanted to like this camera. It has a really nice lens with great range, the build quality and overall feel is excellent. The LCD resolution is fantastic and the camera is a joy to shoot with. The burst mode is good and auto focus quite solid.
As for the bad, the image quality could be great except the color processing and accuracy are absolutely terrible. I tried adjusting so many settings to get this right (white balance, hue, saturation, etc.) and I never could. I even got a second camera due to a defective flash on the first and it performed the same with poor color reproduction. I really ... hated this because I liked the camera, but I don't always have time to do multiple shots and color tweaks in my shooting needs. While I enjoy full manual shooting (which this camera does not have BTW) and tweaks, often I just want a good crisp image in a P or scene type mode where good memories aren't ruined with flat colors and poor color accuracy.
As much as I hate to give up the extra zoom I'll be going to a Canon S95 which I know will give typical crisp Canon images with lower noise using the bigger 1/1.7" sensor. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good to Excellent pictures
Cons: Unpredictable manufacturing quality
This camera has taken good to excellent quality pictures. It took very little time to learn the different settings and it was well worth the time invested. The size is perfect, it looks and feels and weigh like a well built expensive compact SLR not like most point and shoot cameras. This was purchase for Christmas and New Year vacation casual picture taking because I did not want to carry around all the time a bulky and heavy SLR. The pictures were good to excellent quality almost like taken with an SLR pro camera. One problem was that after a few weeks of using it, the lense stucked halfway out and the camera totally stopped working. I like the quality of the pictures it has produced and wou ... ld not want to just throw it away or park it so the solution is to get it fix and this issue may come up after the manufacturer warranty. Highly reccommended that you invest a few dollars on the extended warranty. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am new to this camera but from what I have seen so far I am very impressed. This camera takes almost SLR quality pictures. The zoom on this thing is amazing for such a small camera. The screen is large and very vivid. The placement of the flash could have been better thoughtout, but I have gotten used to it. Also the video is very good quality for a point and shoot. I think you would be hard pressed to find another point and shoot that offers this kind of quality images and video, especially for the price. If you're shopping for a 10x zoom camera near or just below the price of this one spend the extra money on it. I did and I was not disappointed. Prior to this I bought a pentax RZ10 14mp camera and sent it back, I got this one instead and have't looked back.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Not happy with that. but Im sure its my fault for not knowing how to set the camera right for the right enviroment. * It takes Fantastic shots at night or low light. * The face detection is ni ... ce, dosnt work well if the people are far away of course. * When taking movies and full time auto focus is enabled, there is a clicking noice that can be heard in the video, the noise is the camera focusing the lense. * Excellent zoom quality. * For 300 burgers. I would of thought it would come with a 2GB card at least. But no it does not. so I bought a 32GB class 10 SD card for it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small, easy to use, great photos
Cons: battery does not last long.
I bought this before I went on vacation. It is so easy to use, and fits in a pocker while traveling or when I am not taking pictures. Lots of features like fill-in flash, reducing backlighting, closeup photos, excellent clarity for extreme zoom shots. Also very easy to quickly change settings to account for the current photo situation. It also takes great movies! I'm glad I bought it. One negative is that the battery does not last long, and the low battery indicator comes on very shortly before the battery dies. The camera does not have a continuous battery monitor icon so you would know when the battery starts getting low.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I shoot professionally with canon & panasonic and sometimes Red, so I have better quality cameras to compare this to whether fair/unfair. For the money this little camera is great to have on hand because it takes really nice pics. The strength of this camera is shots taken with natural light (outdoors). I personally prefer the look of Nikon over Canon, but Nikon still lags behind in the features dept (as of this writing). I think the stereo mic was overkill, it's not like you're shooting a movie with this thing, but the video is adequate. If you want a true little work horse, thats blazingly fast when autofocussing, and don't want to break the bank, buy this camera. My last pocket camera was Sony and i'm soooooo glad I upgraded. I keep it in my pocket or camera bag all the time.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality
Cons: Lens error; placement of flash; no battery charger
I loved this camera when I got it! It was red! and took awesome pictures! Even the fact that the flash couldn't pop up when I was holding the camera and blocked it, kinda bothered me but the fact the pictures were awesome negated that fact! It kinda bothered me that there was no battery charger, just the USB charger kinda bothered me, but it took AWESOME pictures, so that was OK. What did bother me was when I got that dreaded "LENS ERROR" message and the lens would not retract. After a little research (that I should have done BEFORE I bought the camera) I found out that this is not an uncommon problem!! In fact when I called Nikon the Customer Service Representative almost second guessed me and ... knew exactly what I was talking about! Fix!! Therein lies the problem. I had to send it back to Nikon AT MY EXPENSE to have it fixed. Not going to happen when the camera isn't even 3 months old! Not now, not never! I depend on my camera and do not want to be without it for several weeks! Since it was less than 90 days old, I returned it to Costco, and learned mine was not an isolated case. Many others had been returned within the 90 day period for the same problem! Now for the kicker! Nikon sent me an e-mail and asked me to please review the camera. I did and put precisely the same thing on the review and received an e-mail back saying my review had been REJECTED! I guess they only want the warm glowing reviews. I really did love the quality of the pictures and would have probably got another Nikon since they were $50 cheaper at the time I returned it, except for the fact I thought it would happen again and I don't want to go through this again! Once they iron out the kinks on this thing it will be an awesome camera!!!!" expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: COOLPIXS8100BK - Nikon COOLPIX S8100 Black 12.1 Megapixels Digital Camera review
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality,Easy To Use,Good in Low Light,Nice Body Color,Large Clear LCD
I needed a new camera to photograph my baby. I wanted somethign lightweight and smaller than an SLR to stash in my pocket when we go for walks so I can always be camera ready. This camera met my needs and everyone is happy to have new pictures of the baby.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera to replace a point and shoot that was getting older. I have owned four p&s cameras and all have had problems with low light shots. The S8100 really performs in low light. This camera really surprised me with the the photo quality. It is not quite as good as my D300 but for the price and portability this little camera is hard to beat. Wish it had manual controls but the features for fast shooting and the bonus of 1080P video makes up for that.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for stills; fantastic for movies.
Item.Review: Possibly the best small point and shoot to date. I bought this camera so that I wouldn't have to take the big lens to a wedding. I used the movie mode to shoot the wedding and was truly amazed with the results. The HD movie of the wedding was praised by everyone as professional looking even though it was the first time I had used the movie mode. The stills were spectacular. The only drawback was in low light situations, but for a compact camera, it was very satisfactory.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice camera for the money. Good in low light
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, goood low light photos
Cons: Nothing
This is just the right size to fit in a coat pocket, but not too small to operate the controls comfortably. Battery life is very good and I like being able to charge the battery inside the camera. Get a fast memory card if you want to use high def movie mode. The flash popping up on the left side is easy to get used to. I actually like the location. If you learn to use the various preset functions, you can take some very good pictures. You can even take natural looking photos indoors without a flash.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Would have expected more from Nikon.
Item.Review:
Pros: Superb photos and HD movies. It's a Nikon.
Cons: Memory card, USB cable, flash
Camera is OK but not the "top-shelf" product that I would have expected from Nikon. I also shoot a D-70 Nikon SLR which is superb. But why are the memory cards different between the D-70 and the S8100? I use both, often at the same shoot, and being able to swap cards between cameras when needed would make more sense. The USB cable that plugs into the camera is S8100 specific, different from the D-70 and different than a standard USB. Why can't all of the Nikon products use a standard USB plug on the camera port end? It would make everything more simple and stop the searches for the right cable for the right camera. Like other users I am annoyed with the flash that pops up under your ... fingers when holding the camera. I am learning to live with it but there must be a better way/location. On the positive side, the camera shoots great with lots of powerful features that make it an excellent pocket camera or backup camera when the digital SLR is to much to haul around. The program selection wheel on top is similar to the SLR and the user can quickly select the desired mode. The "grid-on" feature is very handy when "shooting thirds." HD movies are great. Buy it. Nothing is perfect. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am just a casual photographer. I have had this camera for about a month. The camera worked very well at an indoor car show. Of 106 photos that I took, only two were out of focus. It does very well in low light. I have gotten used to the flash location...right where you would normally put your left index finger. The 10x zoom is very good. I am still experimenting with different settings for various situations. The highest resolution settings are apparently compressed. The file sizes are not as large as they should be at 12mp. When shooting in macro mode at 12mp, the edges of objects are pixcellated and sometimes have a halo along bright edges. I have been taking shot at 8mp and they look better to me than the 12mp photos. I don't plan on using this camera for video but I was c ... urious so I have experimented with it. It does a pretty good job and playback from the camera looks good. At the current default setting for the focus, it tends to drift on occassion. I attempted editing a video clip at 1080p on my computer and playback was very jerky. I am using a class 10 SD card so that is not the problem. Today I tried shooting at 720p and the results were better. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: We use the camera for general picture taking and an occasional HD Video. The pictures are crisp and clear and the facial recognition feature does a pretty good job at focusing in on what's most important. The video quality was amazing, So far the camera is easy to use to get good results. I feel we have only scratched the surface with its capabilities. Definitely reasonably priced for the quality.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A little high-maintenance but some beauties are.
Item.Review:
Pros: Design, Photo Quality-especially in daylight, Speed, Menus, Zoom Clarity, Low light capability, Lots of shooting modes.
Cons: Not a good P&S camera, Focus, Auto shots in low light, Lack of more manual settings, Low shutter speed on flash photos
This is a beautiful camera and I bought it because it felt great. It was different than the boring old Panasonic and Sonys. Love the scroll wheel and the fantastic display screen. Best, most concise menu of the competitive brands. I spent two weeks going over all of the specs and reviews of the better super zooms and visited the retail stores to test them out. Since I couldn't find a clear winner, went with the feel good choice. Plus it was on sale for $218 here at BestBuy. And the first day out, I was not disappointed. I own ... a DSLR for the super quality stuff but missed my old olympus compact when I lost it a few months back. The first day out was impressive. Photographed seals at about 30 ft at full zoom and you could count the hairs and the grains of sand. I knew I'd made the right choice.
Unfortunately, the performance isn't what it could be, especially in low light situations. Don't get me wrong, it does a great job especially if you have hands of a brain surgeon and your subject is a statue. It takes great pics at 800 ISO yet the auto mode only goes to 400 in most cases. Yes, you can adjust manually but I'm guessing most people take photos in low light of other people that tend to move. Vibration reduction and Motion detection are disappointing. I would think that Nikon would figure that automatically keeping the shutter speed as high as possible would result in better candid photos which is what most people use P&S camers for. There are some cool modes to enhance low light shooting but they are a bit complex for your average P&S shooter. The potential is definitely there.
And then there's the focus problems. Most P&S's have at least a little bit of a problem with low light focusing but this camera is somewhat inconsistent. One the the main reasons that I bought this camera was to take it to social events and most are at night. My first batch probably had 40-50% blurry FLASH photos. Almost took it back the next day. But it was just such a beautiful specimen ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I took my new camera on vacation and loved it. It takes excellent pictures and video. Love how you can start video recording by a simple push of the button. Battery life was excellent. Sometimes difficult to get it on the right setting.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use
Cons: Sound during zooming video
I used this camera and shot from a moving car for over 1600 miles. It fulfilled every expectation for a single lense relex without the lenses. In it milishot setting I was able to shoot 8 consecutive shots and keep the good one. In night mode I shot the skyline at 3000 ISO. This camera is really outstanding and has a cmos chipset that outperforms all the rest. It's double steady mode really keeps things sharp no matter how much you move. It's 300 mm zoom can be hand held and still remain sharp. The video recordings are 1080p, second to none. Sharp clear videos that capture everything clearly and easily with a puch of one button. The menu system rotates to locate the type of shooting you are doing. It is intuative. The best ca ... mera I have ever used. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Clarity of the LED screen.
Cons: Pop up flash in bad spot?
This camera has many features and takes great pictures and movies. It is easy to use and I was amazed and the clarity of the LED screen. For the money we have been more than happy so far.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use and quality pictures
Cons: A smidgen heavier that other compacts...but not bad.
I have a number of digital compact's and found this one to be full of features. Most of the features are easy to use and intuitive. Contrast is very good...takes great color pics in the various available modes. The camera is well made of good quality materials. It's hard to beat the Nikon lens system. I noticed on previous reviews, some had focusing problems and blurring of pics. Would advise you to study the owners manual(s) and be more aware of the controls and features. I take numerous pics and have yet to be disappointed in the results. If you like ease of pic taking with good quality and great portability this is a camera you should consider!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good for the price, nice features
Item.Review:
Pros: 1080p Video Rec, Night Shots, 10x Zoom
Cons: Autofocus, No battery charger in the box
I think I did a great buy. Night shots are very good and I like the 10X zoom I would more but had to expend more money as well. I have used the "manual" focus and works great too. The best part is the 1080p video recording. Movies look awesome in my FullHD LCD. It's a shame it only records on .MOV format so you have to convert the video file in order to play it on most of BluRay players. Even when the auto focus is slow and not accurate sometimes and there is no battery charger included in the box(Is not that convenient charging the battery inside the camera) I'm satisfied with the product.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Been a great camera so far. Took it to the Sugar Bowl and had excellent zoon including the digital zoom - imaes came out pretty clear. Low light images been much better than any other point and shoot camera. The HD video is clear and sound quality is very good. This camera has many little options that will make the picture taking better. I love the automatic scene selection. This does a very good job of selecting the type of scene and adjusting the camera setup to take a very good image. I have been very happy with this camera so far. It does take some time to get use to the flash location but a minor issue for me.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: requires minimal setup for great pictures anytime.
Solid camera, great pictures. Does require a little setup to ensure crisp pictures but once it's set your good to go. Great point a shoot camera with plenty of options if you feel like using them. Great value at a great price.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I'm still learning but I like ease of use sofar
Item.Review: Bought this camera to take night pictures of xmas lights. Put it on automatic and the results were spectacular. Just have to make sure I don't move. Have accidentally started to film because of the placement of that button but not a big problem. I figured out how to do a time delayed shutter without the manual and am looking forward to using the other features. The nikon software is not my favorite and use others to edit etc. But overall I am very happy

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very nice camera - great for close ups
Item.Review:
Pros: Great close ups and picture quality in general
Cons: Grainy lowlight and not good for a first time user
I must have read dozens of reviews for a handful of different cameras. In the end, I kept coming back to this one. It takes great pics,but only after you find the right setting. It is not as user friendly as some point and shoots, so I would recommend only to those who are comfortable with more than the basic.
There were key components that I consider when looking to spend a decent amount of money like this:
1) Picture quality 2) Shutter recovery (ability to take another picture quickly) 3) Low light photography 4) Macro / close-ups 5) Zoom
I have owned a Panasonic Lumix for a few years (and love it), but wanted something new, though I ... had a price range to stick to. I wanted more than the 10x zoom, but it works well for what it has. I have tested it in many different instances in the past month. At first, I was a little disappointed because it didn't seem to be taking good low light pictures at all. There are a number of low light settings on the top dial, but after I messed with it for a little while I found the Night Landscape setting most affective for most low light still photography. If your subject is moving, you are going to need a flash, which works decent (except that the darn thing pops up where your finger naturally goes to hold the camera, a very common complaint with this model). The bad thing is that the low light pics without flash come out a little grainy, but then unless you are working with a dslr with a tripod, it's not going to be perfect. Pictures taken with a zoom do alright, but sometimes it take a second for the zoom to kick in, and when it does, it is a bit too sensitive and zooms too much. My Lumix did the same, so I wasn't too bothered. It takes pictures quickly (though with a typical small pause for ones with a flash). I did take some excellent closes up at the zoo. The quality and color come out quite nice. It took me a couple days to really get a feel for this. It was not as user friendly, even though I am comfortable with most point ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera hoping to carry one device for both still and video that is also pocket friendly as an upgrade to my trusty Panasonic ZS3. So far, I took approx. 1000 pics and a couple dozens of video with S8100 under various conditions, from bright outdoor to night indoors and found the pictures to be very good, with a lot less noise than my Panasonic ZS3. The auto setting does a very good job for most lighting situation, fast focus, except for backlight situation. It is best that you enable the backlighting mode manually. Flash range appears to be 15 ft or so. I tried the burst mode, it works in well lit situation and pretty good with minor blur indoor during day time. I don't like the wheel control, I tend to overshoot the selection. A simple D pad, 5 ways would work just fine. And ... now to the video. You can zoom in video mode but it adds noise to the video. Video is very sharp when the camera gets its focus but unfortunately the focus is hunting 20 percent of the time. Worst yet, the focus mechanism makes a very loud clicking noise. I did notice that if you snap a picture before taking a video, the clacking, clicking noise is much reduced. Anti shake works well in photo but just ok in video. It's smooth until you pan then sometimes the video is a bit jumpy. Surprisingly taping while walking is fairly smooth, as long as you don't zoom in or out. So in conclusion, I hope the s8100 is a nice upgrade to my Panasonic ZS3 but it turns out to be a minor one. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera as a companion to my Nikon D70 for its point and shoot capability. But I also wanted to have a good movie resolution (1080p) so that I can take movies of my great nieces and nephews. One thing that set this camera apart from others I looked at was the ability to have the left hand support the camera without getting in the way of the lens. This camera will be great for hiking and traveling. I love the zoom and the number of megapixels for being able to enlarge my shots.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: After doing my homework, I purchased this fine camera to replace an aging Sony DSC-T30 subcompact that I use when we travel. (The Sony is showing dust bunnies on the sensor that I'm getting tired cloning/fixing in post-processing). My Nikon D90/lenses is my first choice for most of my photography. As I played with the S8100, I really liked everything I found. What a terrific form factor, feel, photos quality, and easy menus set-up. What I came across, though, is there's no simple way to set a high speed shutter to freeze the subject while shooting from a moving ship/boat/plane/vehicle. I knew going in there wasn't ap- or shutter-priority, which was okay. I just thought somewhere in the extensive presets/scenes modes there'd be a Sports or high-speed shutter preset/scene. (I guess Nikon e ... ngineering thought Food might've been a more-used preset/scene than high-speed shutter?). I traded correspondence with Nikon tech support (use burst mode) and posted on some Nikon web forums (push ISO really high). Those work-arounds had trade-offs (forced lower file sizes for the burst mode because it fills up the internal buffer, and possible high noise levels for artificially high ISO settings), plus there's not a way to get to those settings and then return to normal shooting quickly. This was a deal-killer for me, so I reluctantly returned this otherwise fine camera for a refund. I'll deal with my Sony's dust bunnies because there's really nothing else out there that can compete with this S8100, and I'll hope Nikon adds a high-speed shutter scene/preset in one of its next versions of this otherwise terrific camera expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use my camera for personal use of family and friends. I'm not an advanced camera user and mostly use the Auto function. So far, every picture and movies has been perfect!!! I'm not crazy about the user manual being on disk rather than hard copy. I also prefer a lens view for some pictures - which this camera does not have. Other than that, I love the camera!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I like it a lot. The quality of the pictures are very good. Awesome outdoor pictures. And very good indoor pictures. I haven??t yet explored all it??s features, but I believe I can take better quality pictures. I really like the macro feature that the camera has. Everybody mentioned about the position of the flash. I was aware of that while taking pictures and got used to it. It??s very easy to carry around. I bought a coolpix leather case and it was great. I recommend. I also recommend purchasing the battery charger. I didn??t like to charge the battery inside the camera. I also bought an extra battery. I always do, for all my cameras. This camera let you know that battery is low and very soon it will shut down. So I also recommend an extra battery.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: One of the best oint and shoot to date
Item.Review: I have owned several point and shoot cameras of various brands, Nikon did an excellent job with this one. Very large display, great resolution It makes an great addition to my DSLR cameras Highly recommend it for the begineer as well as expert.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I recently lost my camera that I used for travel, and after a bit of research, I decided to buy the Nikon CoolPix S81000. This is a great little camera for that purpose. After more than a week of traveling and taking pictures, I did not need to recharge the battery once, and I even purchased an additional battery just in case. Photos are sharp, and the camera works particularly well in low light situations. Zooming is quite good, and the menu offers lots of options for customizing the camera for different situations, e.g. no flash, night photos, playback. I am quite happy with this camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon CoolPix S8100 WORTH EVERY PENNY!
Item.Review: Our last digital camera died. I was determined NEVER to buy that brand again. I asked two of my photographer friends what would be a good, family digital camera that would take both high quality pictures and videos. They both said you need a Nikon. We use it for ALL of our family pictures and videos. We never go anywhere without it. We HAD to have one with a rechargeable battery; the CoolPix has it! We had to have video; the CoolPix has it! We had to have some decent optical zoom; it has it! It is very easy to use for my wife, and when she accidentally set the brightness too high, I didn't have any trouble figuring out how to set it correctly again. At this point, we don't have ANY complaints! It was exactly what we were looking for, high quality video (1080) and high quality pics (12 mp). ... We bought a refurbished one off the website and it works fine! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Awesome Cam. and it's a refurb
Item.Review: Out of the box it takes amazing photo's, doesnt take long to focus, for the size the flash is great, ton's of features. It was refurbished and it's like new. I use the video feature with dartfish to do movement analysis with the athlete's I train.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This camera is a definite win!
Item.Review: I absolutely love this camera! I'm a novice photographer and I love the convience this point and shoot offers. Its pictures are almost as good as my nikon D40 but the shell is small enough to stick in my purse and go. The price is great too. It's almost $40 cheaper than I've seen anywhere else. If you're looking for a camera that takes great pictures at an affordable price, look no more!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm going right for the throat on this one, I own the Nikon S8000 and the video sound is true amazing bass rich stereo on that one. I can record anything including loud live concerts perfect. Thought the S8100 would be a step up with its full 1920x1080 HD video and it was but the KILLER was that the sound was a cheaper less bass stereo sound and distorts if too loud. The biggest reason I'm going to return it is when you zoom in and out with the video the sound muffles to half the true sound and then goes back to true sound once zoom is stopped. Totally annoying! Its like grabbing the volume know and going from 10 to 5 then back to 10. How can a newer model go backwards in certain quality? They update to a full HD video product and then go backwards from 14.2 to 12.1 megapixels compared to ... the S8000. Also when on continuous auto focus it sounds like ya have a little rattlesnake in your hands! Great little product with issues they shouldn't have for a newer model over the discontinued S8000. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a great little point'n'shoot camera that has some interesting features to help the beginners as well as some manual control for the more advanced. The night shots are extremely sharp due to the backlit CMOS sensor and is well worth the $$$ especially if travelling and taking pictures often outside at dusk. The only downsides with this camera are the rather slow optical zoom, and the automatic focus that isn't very intuative. IF your an advanced photographer and want to get artsy with your pictures then this camera is probably not for you. However if your looking for a camera to travel with and take some beautiful portrait and landscape pictures (color is amazing) then this is definatley one to look at.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera. Thanks B&H and Cnet!
Item.Review: I bought this camera because I wanted a nicer point and shoot that wasn't going to cost me as much as a dSLR. It is great for low light environments and is pretty fast. The quality of the pictures is great and I would recommend it to anyone.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great pics and video but not very user friendly.
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality
Cons: very complicated
Decieded to buy this Nikon because I wanted the 1080 video. This camera takes great pictures and video, but it is not very user friendly. The software with this camera is not very helpful and complicated to use compared to Canon. Also the pop-up flash is horrible....it's located right where you would normally hold the camera.... Overall, it performs its functions perfectly, but if I had to do it over again, I would buy a Canon....

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small, Easy to Use, Good Pictures
Cons: Pop Up Flash
We bought this for our trip to NYC. It is small enough to carry in our coat pockets and relatively easy to use. No problems as of yet. Still trying to work out the panoramic software. Takes clear pictures, decent shutter speed and battery lasted all day when we took 350 pictures. Only bad thing I can say is the pop up flash is a bit of a pain. Otherwise, this is a great travel camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: THis was purchased to replace the camera I carry with me all the time since I can't take the DSLR everywhere. So far it has served very well - the macro option is far better than any I've seen on a point and shoot. Still figuring out all of the settings and options and haven't used it for for shooting gymnastics yet, which is huge issue in my house. Love that I can crop a photo while it's still in the camera!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: For the price, this is a great value.
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, zoom, video quality and ease of use
Cons: Location of flash
Takes awesome pictures even on the auto setting. The only flaw (as other people have mentioned) is that the location of the flash is placed where you would naturally want to put your fingers to hold the camera. After using the camera for a few weeks, you get used to it, and I think some people are making a bigger deal about it than they need to. If people really don't like it, then you probably shouldn't be buying a compact camera.
The other thing I really like about this camera is the quality of the video. It takes amazing videos, and is super easy to record a video. All around , I would definitley recommend this camera if you want a higher quality compact camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Very sharp, high-quality images! This camera picks up on light really well. The start up time is in the blinking of an eye, the zoom is like a pair of binoculars, and the HD video is amazing. I like that you can take pictures while you're recording video. It's the perfect point-and-shoot for a DSLR user and anyone who wants a good, sharp image.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality
Cons: Build quality
This is a good camera for the money. We bought three cameras in this price range. The Canon SX210IS and Sony cyber shot H55. The Sony was ok but couldn't compete with picture quality. The canon was the easiest to use but the picture quality was the worst. The screen for the Nikon was the clearest and easiest to see. Sony came in second and Canon was by far the worst. The only problem I have with the Nikon was a ring in the ring assemble started to come out only about a month in. I exchanged it no problem but then bought the best buy warranty in case of further problems. If picture quality is the most important to you you need to go with the Nikon. I ran a test with each camera and five test subjects. Took the same picture and had them ... pick out what they thought was the best one. Every time it was an easy choice. Nikon! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Image quality and auto tracking features
Cons: Pop up flash Location
This is the best point and shoot I've ever owned. It gives 'DSLR' quality images. Excellent focus options. The only thing I would change is pop up flash. Sometimes my fingers are in the way. But you get used to it. It's still a 5 star camera overall.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Almost proffesional photos with a digital camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Excelent quality, good price.
Cons: It has not charger independent, you must use the camera to charge the battery.
Exelcent camera, good relation price-quality. The photos are very clear, the optical zoom works very well despite the distance. The videos are recorded with high quality. Definitely I recommend this camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Camera purchased for new baby arriving. Will also be used for outdoors activities and trips when larger SLR is not taken. Overall it is a very solid camera. Well built, logical and easy to use and produces very good pictures. The LCD screen has excellent resolution, and the size of the camera is perfect - not the smallest of the point-and-shoot cameras, but a comfortable size such that it is extremely portable but feels substantial in your hand. The low light ability of the camera is excellent. Easy to start and fire quickly. Have not mastered all the shooting features yet but so far very pleased. The HD video is great, crisp and clear shots. They look great in youtube, email or when hooked directly into HD TV. Drawbacks include: poor location of flash --- flash is right under le ... ft index finger -takes getting used to in order to avoid blocking the flash from popping up. When shooting video the lens mechanics are noisy as you zoom in and out. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
If you are looking for a great point and shoot, then this is for you. Like any new device it has its quirks that all seem to stem around the autofocus feature.
Otherwise....great buy and well worth the investment.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture Quality
Cons: nothing yet...
This camera was a Christmas present for my boyfried. He needed an upgrade and had been looking at this camera for a while. Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Can't take a clear picture in low light/ no light
Item.Review:
Pros: The HD video is exceptional.
Cons: The night pictures
I was very excited to purchase this camera for its night picture capabilities but have been extremely disappointed. I keep saying that maybe I need to play with it more but everytime I do the pictures are blurry and dark. the automatic settings on a point and shoot should be able to take good pictures for each of their designated settings but not on this camera. It requires going in and manually changing the settings for the situation. Not what I wanted for my point and shoot. I have a DSL for that. I bought this camera a month ago and have yet to take a good picture.

Pros: everything
Cons: nothing so far

I love it with three kids it can focus on all three faces at once to include each one the first time i take the picture. It seems easy to use and the pictures are great!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great zoom lens, fast start up time

There are two modes I especially like, the continuous shooting mode, and the night shooting mode. There is one feature I am still getting used to, and that is the pop up flash. Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Review:

Cons: It's a little bulkier and heavier than most point-n-shoot cameras

I read several reviews before finally buying this camera because of the mixed bag of opinions. I have had no difficulty using this camera because I read the operator's manual first. In my mind that makes a HUGE difference. This camera does so much that if you skip reading the manual, you are cheating yourself. It focuses sharply and easily, zooms great, and its many shooting modes offer all kinds of filtering possibilities built into the camera. I absolutely LOVE this camera. And, when I bought it online for $216 I felt like I was stealing it ... . It's nearly as good as a digital SLR without all that bulk and weight. I've only used the video mode once but that is great too with1080i HD and stereo sound. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:

The S8100 takes forever to find the subject in low light situations and by the time you get the picture, the subject may have moved. I thought by now, the gurus at Nikon would have done better than this. Colors are washed out with the blueness, and lack of good contrast. I expected better from a camera this advanced. I may take it back.

Cons: the flash can be overpowering some shots but most are very well done.
This camera is great for a point and shoot. It's Fast and very easy to use. It has no manual settings witch is fine since it is a point and shoot. Flash can be a little Full at times but it does a good job. love the 10x zoom. It's small compact size with a large zoom everything you should need for a point and shoot camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Small / Compact; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Short Lag Time; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Easy To Use; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality
I did some research on many Point and Shoot Cameras and decided to try the Nikon S8100. I know there might be some more with more bells and whistles and more manual control, but that is not why I bought this camera. If I want manual control, I will just use my D700. I compared many brands at low light and zoom features and image stabilization. I read pro's and con's for all point and shoots. I do mostly landscapes and occasional portraits. I did some test shots in low light and it will shoot at 800 with no problem. I believe I can shoot at 1600 and use a little noise reduction and still get ... a great image. No point and shoot will be comparable to a DSLR anyway. If you want low noise capabilities, then go with a DSLR! I took some test shots with the camera in AUTO mode and macro mode. The images are very sharp and I was amazed at it capability in shooting in fairly low light without using the flash. You can shoot 5 frames in about one second! You have many scene modes if you want to use them but you can adjust manually the AF metering and metering area for exposure. You have adjustments for Exp Compensation and Vividness just like the Nikon DSLR. It also has the VR image stabilization that works great! It can also do pano's! Overall, I think the camera will serve my purpose! No complaints. Happy Nikon owner! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, features, video, great in low light
Cons: short battery life, charger, blurry with moving objects, sound when zooming in
I bought this camera after reading reviews after reviews and watching youtube videos. I'm going to cut to the chase.... I give it an A. Yes, when you zoom in, you hear the noise from the motor zooming in but this is only if there is no other noise in the video. If your recording noise, then the motor is not able to be heard. When I was using the camera at the store, I realized that anything moving came out blurry in the pictures. I didn't like this so I called over an employee. He agreed with me that on paper the camera sounded excellent. The blurry pictures were annoying though. I bought the camera anyway b/c I was set on it. I took pictures a ... lmost immediately and the quality was amazing. Low light with no flash pictures were exceellllent! When using the flash in a lighted room (a little more light then low light) it was too bright. The camera is easy to work with. It has a smile setting that takes the picture when everyone is smiling. That feature is pretty cool. As well as skin softening... The battery charger is an F for me. The thing is, you have to charge the battery in the camera and can't use the camera while it charges. Also, the first day I used it, the full battery only lasted about 5 hours! Idk what happened there. Maybe it was me but that was way to fast. I took about 75 pictures and it died. All in all, I enjoy this camera. The video quality is excellent outdoors. The video is not made for indoor use so doesn't work too well indoors. Its a slick matte look and pocketable. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The picture quality is astounding!
Cons: Can't find a thing yet.
We saw this camera on Sale at Bestbuy.com and did a little research. We had planned to buy a DSLR, but this seemed like too good of a deal to pass up. Guess what? We were right!
This is the most amazing Point and Shoot I have ever used! I truly did not expect such good quality out of it, but this camera can take every bit as good a picture as a basic DSLR can, likely even better than some!
It was dark out when we got ours, so our first shots were no flash, outdoor shots. We could see more detail in the picture than we could see in person!
I have read a lot of people complaining about the Auto Focus. I am guessing NONE of them read the owner's manual. It lays it out very clearly that da ... rk subjects are difficult to track with Auto Focus. Put it in a more manual mode and you will be just fine.
I would recommend this Camera to anyone.. As a bit of proof, I took this picture, in Macro mode, no flash, low light and took it QUICKLY because I was trying to catch a speeding kitten. http://i19.photobucket.com/albums/b185/viriiguy/macrotest2016crop.jpg expand » « collapse

After tweaking the settings i figured out how to adjust the pictures. Ok so far so goo. But then when you zoom into an object from afar, it was really out of focus and the camera seemed to have a problem focusing on objects at a distance. Without zoom, its fine yet maybe 3 out of 5 pictures i took were blurry. Its unfortunate because the 14x zoom was on of the features that drew me to this camera. I LOVE IT! Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Review:

Cons: Menu system could be better

Great video, Optical zoom during video, and of course the great quality of pictures that Nikon is known for. Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon S8100 Best Camera for the Money
Item.Review: Very easy to use, ease of access to different picture modes. Easy to review previous pictures, and LCD screen has great clarity. Only minor qualm is where the flash is at. Usual holding of camera with left index finger on top left corner of camera (flash pops up there) prevents flash popping up. Minor adjustment of holding the point and shoot camera differently. Great camera overall.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I don't think this camera can decide if it is a point-and-shoot, or one of the big guys. The size and ease of use would suggest P&S, but the features (like histogram, wide range of selectable ISO, built-in HDR, high resolution video, selectable metering, fantastic night shots, continuous autofocus and 'following the action') all would suggest one of the big guys. The features are impressive. The quality, both image and build, is outstanding. The size is convenient. To me, it's the best little camera on the market today.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Upgraded to this camera for the zoom factor.
Item.Review:
Pros: Bought this camera during cyber Monday. Great deal! Very easy to use and love the zoom.
Cons: On / off button is near flash button.
Love this camera. Just not crazy about night time feature. You have to be very still to get a decent picture. Otherwise, my daytime and indoor pictures come out great.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Short Lag Time; Great Zoom; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact
Cons: Poor Flash
Takes really good pics in low light without the flash. Really amazing that the camera is so small with all the features. Build quality seems excellent. Only cons so far: flash can be too bright & make photos not natural looking. No way to adjust flash output. Camera could really use either a "sport" mode that forces a fast shutter without reducing image size or a shutter mode that would allow you to directly set the shutter speed. Flash issue is less of a problem though because the camera makes great pics in most lower light situations without the flash (ISO 400-800). A firmware update should be able to f ... ix the issues & camera then would be a definite 5 star product. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon S8100 better than Sony HX5V
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Short Lag Time; Nice Body Color; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Small / Compact; Easy To Use
After extensively researching and trying out the Nikon S8100 and the Sony HX5V I've came to the conclusion that even when both are great point and shoot cameras the S8100 delivers the best image accuracy an photo quality out of the two. The S8100 is designed and built with the photo enthusiastic and the seasoned photographer in mind but most importantly it does what Nikon does best; quality photography. You could get couple of extra features on the HX5V that you won't get on the S8100 (GPS and a panoramic sweep features) but for the most part these two cameras are almost identical when specs are co ... mpared side by side. However, if you have the opportunity to try them out you'll find out that the difference lays on how Nikon's technology processes images with much accuracy even when both have the same sensor. (Nikon's being a hair bigger which is a good thing). Other thing to consider is the lens in the S8100, in my opinion is a superior lens. For example. It has a lens correction component that gets the warp effect you get with HX5V when full zoomed out photos are taken. One negative aspect I found on the S8100 though was the noise captured by the mics when using the zoom on video mode. In conclusion, if you strive for image quality and reliability then you'll find out that this Nikon S8100 is prabably today's (11/06/10) best point in the market. expand » « collapse

Item.Review: The only thing I am uncomfortable with is the location of the video button. It is located where you normaly put your thumb and I am constantly turning on the video mode.

The Resolution is smaller than S8000 but photo quality seems to be much better in normal light setting as well as low light setting. Focusing time and Leg time are pretty faster as well.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Best all around camera for the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Low-light shots, fast, effortless, intuitive, quality-built, great pictures
Cons: Video may not come out well in low-light,
I just bought a dSRL Canon T2i and previously owned a Canon G6. So picture quality was very important to me. I've also used dozens of point n shoots (in my company) - Sony, Casio, Kodak and various models through the years. While these camera served its purpose for close-ups, non-moving, low-resolution, well-lit situations, on a recent trip, the company camera I took failed me miserably. Wide-angle shots struggling to focus indoor well-lit factory, really bad shots in challenging light situation (trendy dark restaurants), even outdoor pictures was a hit or miss and the resulting quality were mediocre - Using this camera was more frustrating than it ... s worth - I was just not getting consistently clear pictures. I did take my bulky canon along but it was not appropriate for the business trip I was taking where a subtle, smaller camera was more suitable for the purpose (nobody likes to have a paparazzi-type camera pointed at them or in their factory) . I thought it was time for me to get a point n shoot myself. I researched online and decided between Canon ELPH 100/300 or the Panasonic FH 27. Then I walked into Best Buy and literally tried all the cameras near the price range I want to spend. I've also tried the Samsung WB210 & Sony WX9. The one that instantly appealed to me was the Nikon S8100. It powered on quickly and instantly click its first shot like clockwork in challenging store-lighting without flash and it came out gorgeously in the 3" LCD screen. I thought it may have been a fluke so I took a dozen more shots in every direction in the store just to make sure. It was not a fluke, every shot literally came out vividly clear and without effort. So nice was what I keep telling myself. Of course I did not stop there, I kept clicking away, testing other cameras to compare, the results were that some struggle to focus, others making bad shots (pictures coming out really dark or overly bright with its flash). Of course a couple of cameras took fast/pretty good picture ... expand » « collapse
