Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: COOLPIXS8100BK - Nikon COOLPIX S8100 Black 12.1 Megapixels Digital Camera review
Item.Review: Lack of viewfinder and glare on screen make it extremely difficult to see what you are shooting outside in bright light. Took this camera to Europe and hated it outdoors most of the trip because it was so hard to see what I was shooting-hard to frame shot and know how far to zoom in or out. I've shot many pictures with older Nikon digital and Konica SLR without problem. Will keep this camera for indoor shooting where it is excellent, but will get a different camera with a viewfinder for next big vacation trip. Also has a slight lag in stopping with zoom, making it sometimes difficult to get exact focal length.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Product is very nice - just as I expected from others reviews! I am still learning to use but it does seem to be as described - very clear pics and menus are easy to scroll thru ! NICE CAMERA for the NICE PRICE!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy camera and fun to use
Item.Review: This camera is lightweight, and easy to use. The price is right, and has HD video. The picture takes great shots with a excellent zoom. You can zoom into objects far away that you didn't know existed. Highly recommend the camera. User for 2 weeks.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera to replace my kodak m863 which my friend dropped. I debated between this camera and the s9100. The 18x zoom of the s9100 was intriquing, but after reading several reviews, I figured it wasn't worth the extra $100. The s8100 has been everything I hoped it would be. It has been a step up from old camera with the sharpness of the picture, more manual controls to help refine my pics, and the hd video is excellent. The 10x zoom is great and still provides a nice crisp picture. I have tested it in a few low light situations (where my old camera would frequently and frustratingly fail) and have so far been impressed. Sure, the flash placement takes some getting used, but it is by no means a deal breaker. All in all I would definitely recommend this camera to all novice to int ... ermediate users looking for a good all around point and shoot camera! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Everything we need in this little camera!
Item.Review:
Pros: great price for so many quality features
Cons: haven't found any thing not great yet!
Incredible clarity, need to get more familiar with it - my husband is the pro at it. Love the convenience and we never had a camera with such definition.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I had an older Nikon and hated the it because it took so long to snap a picture so I almost bought a Canon. After reading reviews and visiting Nikon website, I decided to get this model. I'm happy with my purchase. It's an awesome camera. Takes excellent pictures. Easy to use. I haven't used the video feature yet.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good pictures, lots of features and options
Cons: Flash location (minor issue)
I bought this camera as a birthday gift for my fiance. She loves it and it takes great pictures. I even got it on sale for a good price. The only thing about this camera that is different, is the location of the flash. I want to put my hand where it is. Besides that minor annoyance, an awesome camera that is worth every penny.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Camera used on Western Caribbean Cruise
Item.Review:
Pros: Small compact and you get both HD pictures & video.
Cons: Night videos!
Shot over 400 HD pictures and 14 vides @ 2 minutes or less each. Day & night pictures were great. I used a 16GB Class 4 SDHC card. I should of used Class 6 or better. I think the videos would have came out better. My night videos were dark and unusable. I need to work on my video recording technique more. Camera is great for shooting pictures and video all in a small easy to carry camera. We love this camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Intuitive menus; Excellent Pictures; Good size
Excellent for family get-togthers. Haven't taken distance shots yet. Flash placement, as noted in many reviews, is a problem.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to use, great in low light settings.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, great pictures even in low light, large LCD display.
Cons: flash pops up in the place where my finger is holding on to the camera.
Love this camera. I was looking for a camera that could shoot clear pictures in low light settings such as a theater or a gymnasium and this camera does the trick. It lets me change the ISO sensitivity to 3200 and that makes all the difference in the world. It also has many fun features including an auto fix that is nice if the picture needs a little adjusting. The only feature that I didn't like was that the flash pops up right where my finger is holding the camera, but then I just move my finger and everything is fine.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good low light picture
Cons: poor low light video recording
for casual point and shoot or beginners this is the it camera.the zoom and lighting in picture mode is incredible. The pictures are exceptionally good in low light conditions. VIdeo recording is good where there is good lighting but terrible in low light conditions. Im alittle upset though just becaause i heard there is a newer model coming out S9100 with x26 zoom... im not sure about the price

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Everyday point and shoot camera. Easy to use with some awesome features and great PIXS. Great about it. Ease of use. Scene options. Clear pixs. Decent video. Not so great. Awkward place for pop-up flash.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Review:

I bought this camera to begin using it for a family vacation to Disney World. Out of the box, it took fantastic pictures! Picture stabilization and noise reduction was very impressive. After messing with some settings, the camera really came alive! I started using the camera as soon as we hit the ground to chronicle the family vacation. There were so many times during the trip that the camera would have just made the memories! We'll see how these HD throw aways turn out! I thought it was a great camera for the money and yo ... u won't be disappointed! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good camera but panoramic not modern.
Item.Review:
Pros: Pictures/features.
Cons: Panoramic feature
This camera is replacing a Sony Cybershot that I lost. I purchased another Sony this past Christmas but the shutter speed was slow. Took it back and the young man that assisted basically told me that "Nikon only deals in cameras" as opposed to Sony. I like Sony products but maybe he was onto something. I traded the Sony for the Nikon and I'm really satisfied. My wife and I travel alot and I like taking panoramic shots. This camera does that but it's not like Sony in that you just press and hold and then move from left to right. With Nikon, you have to take a pic (in the panorama mode), line up the "shadow" of the pic you just took to the picture you're about to take and continue on. Then, w/ the programming that Nikon gives you ... via a CD, you clip and fix the pictures you've just taken. Not much fun but the pictures it does take are very good so I can live with this toil (I guess). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: shutter speed, quick focus, price
Cons: Flash placement! Very hard to get pictures that require a flash
I got this camera because of the faster shutter speeds, the quicker focus, good picture quality (all in the store, mind you)... When I got it home, and started using it in "real life" situations, I became painfully aware that I was going to be missing a LOT of "quick" shots with this camera. The reason for this is that the flash is a pop up flash, and when you're holding the camera, your right index finger holds the flash down! Basically there was no easy way to hold the camera, allow the flash to pop up when necessary, and get your shot.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Neg. - A little big to fit in pocket. - Lens gets dirty very quickly. - Takes forever to get it connected to computer - Flash sometimes gets stuck when rising - When pushing button, if u dont hold it till it focuses it will take blurry pics.(Had to take two shots, to make sure)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The Zoom, the picture quality, the ease of use.
Cons: Haven't found anything I didn't like yet.
I recently purchased the JVC Picsio camcorder because our digital camera took video, but not of a high quality. I got the Picsio specifically for the video camera feature. I knew that this camera also took still pics. I was really disappointed with the still picture quality and there was no flash on the camera. So I saw the annoying commercial on TV for the Nikon S8100 and checked it out. It was better at EVERYTHING than the JVC. It takes higher quality movies and there is no comparison on the still picture quality. I like the fact that you can set it to automatic and it will cover 95% of everything you need. I also like the fact that you can change to a number of different s ... ettings depending on the situation and can modify these further if you know what you are doing. This is by far the best camera I have ever owned and like it better than my sisters $800 camera. The zoom on this is amazing. Sure you have to be still when zooming in fully to avoid blurry pictures, but I haven't had any problems. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have just begun using this camera, but so far so good. Picture quality is great, and the different photo settings are effective and useful. I was particularly impressed with a shot I took of a deer about 30 yards at night using the night landscape setting. I have read complaints about the battery life but haven't found that yet.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Beautiful pictures, but buy the correct SD card.
Item.Review:
I received this camera from Dell about a month ago, and I've been pleasantly surprised at it's performance and picture quality. Warning, the camera does recommend certain SD cards for shooting video.
I was looking at a few models, primarily the Nikon S8100 and the Canon SD4500 IS. I did have the opportunity to use each of them briefly, and ultimately a few things with the Nikon lead to my selecting it. As I didn't intend to use the camera for video shooting, it wasn't a consideration in my selection, however I do have a few comments on that later.
The Nikon has a better wide angle than the Canon (30mm vs 36mm) which I prefer. The macro mode was better on the Nikon. You can shoot up to 1 cm from your subject while with the Canon the closest you can get to your subject is 3 cm. ... Finally, the Nikon seemed to take superior pictures.
After a month of use, it's easy to recommend the S8100. It takes beautiful pictures inside with normal and low light, with very few needing to be deleted due to poor quality. Close-up shots of coins are very accurate, which is important to me as I occasionally sell coins on eBay.
As I mentioned earlier, the correct SD card will make a big difference. I purchased a Class 4 SDHC card with the camera, however a Class 6 card is recommended in the owners manual for shooting video. It warns that a card slower than a Class 6 may result in the video being slow or even stopping.
I would like to also comment on video shooting. If taking video is important to you with your next camera purchase, I would recommend the Canon SD4500 IS over the Nikon. Both record in HD, however the Nikon is in 30fps (frames per second), faster than the Canon, while the Canon is at 24fps, which is more cinematic. The video shot with the Canon was beautiful, the Nikon, acceptable, but not great. The Nikon was using a recommended Class 6 card.
With all of that said, the differences in picture quality give the Nikon a slight edge, while the superior video gives the Canon ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: After so much positive research, I was very diasppointed with this camera. One of the most obvious is that my fingers were in the way when the flash popped up. The quality of the pictures was grainy, both inside & outside, with & without the flash. It was very difficult to switch modes using the dial. I am a female with small fingers & I had trouble. I can't imagine a person with large fingers trying to rotate the dial. Overall, this pruchase was a huge letdown.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Little camera has a LOT of zoom!
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my boyfriend, but I have to admit I really want it for myself now! (I gave it to him anyway though.) I'm really impressed by the zoom range considering how compact the camera is. The lens is really great for such a small camera! I also appreciate the virtual lack of shutter lag, and quick, quiet startup. The only thing I don't really like is that you can't set shutter speeds or apertures. I've also noticed camera shake even with the image stabilization, but that's to be expected just because the camera is so lightweight. Highly recommended!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: A great camera for most occasions. The zoom could be more powerful, but 10X is not too bad. Simple to use, good as a back-up or for those occasions when you don't want to cart your SRL and spare lenses around. Battery performance is not bad, but could be better. I can only join most reviewers in their observations regarding cons: (1) Flash - horrible location and should be controllable. (2) Why not add RAW format? (3) Battery loading is complex since, to lift the rubber lug, I always have to open the battery compartment first. Also, why not use a single piece charger (like Sony has) instead of USB connection plus charger head? I hate having to cart dozens of cables and gadgets around (cellphone, computer, camera) when traveling, and this really should not be too complicated to resolve.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This is a great carry-everywhere camera
Item.Review: I got the S8100 so I could keep a camera with me all the time. The digital SLR I use for intentional photography is too heavy and too bulky, and the 2005 vintage compact digital is too thick to stick in a shirt pocket. The S8100 is easy to pocket and has a pretty good response time, and the images are really sharp. In auto mode this camera is remarkably smart--it's almost scary. I won't trade in the D200--I still need the versatility and speed of an SLR--but with the S8100 I won't catch myself muttering, Dang--I wish I'd had a camera! every time some great photo-op comes and goes. The only thing I wish is that it had a view-finder. I've been a photographer for over forty years and I'm used to holding the camera right up to my face (or looking into a shaded hood) to frame the shot.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: As good as a full size SLR
Item.Review: This is the best compact digital camera I've owned. After purchasing two other compact cameras (Sony and Olympus) in the last 8 years I was ready for a Nikon. This camera takes pictures of the same quality as a full size digital SLR. The full HD video is great for my kids sporting events too!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: AESTHETICS, LOTS OF SHOOTING MODES
Cons: NONE OF THE SHOOTING MODES GIVE GOOD PICTURES!
I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR AN UP COMING TRIP. I USUALLY USE CANON, BUT I HEARD NIKON MADE COMPARABLE CAMERAS. I HAD A CANON POWERSHOT WITH 10X OPTICAL ZOOM BUT IT WAS LITTLE BULKY SO I THOUGHT I'D TRY THIS ONE SINCE IT OFFERED SAME ZOOM MORE FEATURES, AND SUPPOSEDLY BETTER LOW LIGHT SUPPORT.
I TRIED IT OUT LAST NIGHT AT A HALLOWEEN PARTY AND USED EVERY AVAILABLE SETTING TO TRY AND GET SHOTS, AND THEY WERE HORRIBLE, IT WOULDN'T FOCUS, THINGS WERE BLURRY. EVERY ONCE IN A WHILE YOU GET AN OK SHOT, BUT ITS LIKE YOUR LUCKY TO GET 1 OUT OF 5 TO BE GREAT! NEEDLES TO SAY I TOOK IT BACK TO GET CANONS 14X OPTICAL SMALL POWERSHOT. I WOULDN'T TRY OR RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO ANYONE.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:

Gave Cam to my daughter for Xmas, she had cam for a month and got lens error message. I drove 80 mile round trip to Best Buy, where Geek Squad got cam back to me in about 2 and half weeks. Then 3 months later, same lens error message. My gift has not worked for Valentines Day or Mothers Day pix for my daughter to take grandkids' pix! Now making another 80 mile round trip to get cam replaced hopefully. It is obvious this one is a LEMON!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Excellent camera - as others have said, the 10x zoom and 12 MP are a great combination with the CMOS sensor. If you move up to 16mp and greater zoom with the same sensor (e.g., Nikon 9100), your photos will suffer. Quirky flash placement is the only downside. No space for big fingers!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Does well in low light or indoors, what I wanted
Cons: The flash location
I got this camera on cyber Monday and the reviews were excellent during my research. I always had trouble with dim light or indoor photos, and the S8200 addressed that. It takes multiple shots and chooses the best of them to retain. I'm so impressed for P+S, that this takes great photos, even matching to my Nikon SLR, and more compact. The annoying flash pop up that everyone talks about is truly annoying spot, when you give anyone the camera to take shots, pops up where most index fingers are holding cameras. Although people comment that "real" photographers know to hold the camera without index fingers on the top, come on, let's get real, EVERYONE I pass the camera to take a photo of me and a ... group, has their finger above that flash. Nikon should fix that placement. The camera is also very large for compact, so it took forever to find a good camera bag for it, Best Buy's free one was way too large. I got the Lowepro Sausalito, but that is even too snug. Battery life is low. Overall, the quality is great, my most popular one of 8 P+S that I own. expand » « collapse

Well after explaining to all who take my photo & catching myself by surprise at times of that darn flash pop up locatiobn....I got fed up & traded it in for a Canon Elph 310 series before my 30 days was up. Very impressed w/ it & much smaller. The Nikon s8100 was bulky for me, but I wasn't used to a camera that size. I also didn't like the functionality of it. Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact, quick on and off, takes great photos.
Cons: No viewfinder. No separate charger supplied; you must charge the battery in the camera.
This camera is very convenient to use, except for the fact it doesn't have a viewfinder. It's hard to find a camera with a viewfinder these days, but at least this one has a bright enough screen that you can see your shot in all but the brightest light. The camera powers on and off quickly, is easy to use, and takes great photos.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This little camera produces files that are quite large-12MB. The images it produces are quite colorful presumably by the presets in the camera itself, but I found them quite saturated but pleasing for most images. The presets for taking the picture make using this camera relatively simple. The camera does take longer in transcribing the images than similar point and shoot but this is generally a problem.
